title: NIST 800-53 Rev. 5 - Security and Privacy Controls for Information Systems and Organizations
description:
This publication provides a catalog of security and privacy controls for information systems and organizations to protect organizational operations and assets, individuals, other organizations, and the Nation from a diverse set of threats and risks, including hostile attacks, human errors, natural disasters, structural failures, foreign intelligence entities, and privacy risks.

abstract: This publication provides a catalog of security and privacy controls for information systems and organizations to protect organizational operations and assets, individuals, other organizations, and the Nation from a diverse set of threats and risks, including hostile attacks, human errors, natural disasters, structural failures, foreign intelligence entities, and privacy risks. The controls are flexible and customizable and implemented as part of an organization-wide process to manage risk. The controls address diverse requirements derived from mission and business needs, laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines. Finally, the consolidated control catalog addresses security and privacy from a functionality perspective (i.e., the strength of functions and mechanisms provided by the controls) and from an assurance perspective (i.e., the measure of confidence in the security or privacy capability provided by the controls). Addressing functionality and assurance helps to ensure that information technology products and the systems that rely on those products are sufficiently trustworthy.
keywords: assurance; availability; computer security; confidentiality; control; cybersecurity; FISMA; information security; information system; integrity; personally identifiable information; Privacy Act; privacy controls; privacy functions; privacy requirements; Risk Management Framework; security controls; security functions; security requirements; system; system security

securityControls.title: ac-1 - Policy and Procedures
securityControls.description:
• item: {{ac-1_smt.a}} - Develop, document, and disseminate to {{ ac-1_prm_1 }}:
      • item: {{ac-1_smt.a.1}} - {{ ac-1_prm_2 }} access control policy that:
        • item: {{ac-1_smt.a.1.a}} - Addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
        • item: {{ac-1_smt.a.1.b}} - Is consistent with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines; and
      • item: {{ac-1_smt.a.2}} - Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the access control policy and the associated access controls;
    • item: {{ac-1_smt.b}} - Designate an {{ ac-1_prm_3 }} to manage the development, documentation, and dissemination of the access control policy and procedures; and
    • item: {{ac-1_smt.c}} - Review and update the current access control:
      • item: {{ac-1_smt.c.1}} - Policy {{ ac-1_prm_4 }} and following {{ ac-1_prm_5 }}; and
      • item: {{ac-1_smt.c.2}} - Procedures {{ ac-1_prm_6 }} and following {{ ac-1_prm_7 }}.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ac-2 - Account Management
securityControls.description:
• item: {{ac-2_smt.a}} - Define and document the types of accounts allowed and specifically prohibited for use within the system;
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.b}} - Assign account managers;
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.c}} - Require {{ ac-2_prm_1 }} for group and role membership;
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.d}} - Specify:
      • item: {{ac-2_smt.d.1}} - Authorized users of the system;
      • item: {{ac-2_smt.d.2}} - Group and role membership; and
      • item: {{ac-2_smt.d.3}} - Access authorizations (i.e., privileges) and {{ ac-2_prm_2 }} for each account;
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.e}} - Require approvals by {{ ac-2_prm_3 }} for requests to create accounts;
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.f}} - Create, enable, modify, disable, and remove accounts in accordance with {{ ac-2_prm_4 }};
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.g}} - Monitor the use of accounts;
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.h}} - Notify account managers and {{ ac-2_prm_5 }} within:
      • item: {{ac-2_smt.h.1}} - {{ ac-2_prm_6 }} when accounts are no longer required;
      • item: {{ac-2_smt.h.2}} - {{ ac-2_prm_7 }} when users are terminated or transferred; and
      • item: {{ac-2_smt.h.3}} - {{ ac-2_prm_8 }} when system usage or need-to-know changes for an individual;
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.i}} - Authorize access to the system based on:
      • item: {{ac-2_smt.i.1}} - A valid access authorization;
      • item: {{ac-2_smt.i.2}} - Intended system usage; and
      • item: {{ac-2_smt.i.3}} - {{ ac-2_prm_9 }};
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.j}} - Review accounts for compliance with account management requirements {{ ac-2_prm_10 }};
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.k}} - Establish and implement a process for changing shared or group account authenticators (if deployed) when individuals are removed from the group; and
    • item: {{ac-2_smt.l}} - Align account management processes with personnel termination and transfer processes.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ac-3.1 - Restricted Access to Privileged Functions
ac-3.2 - Dual Authorization
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ac-3.2_smt}}, Name: statement - Enforce dual authorization for {{ ac-3.2_prm_1 }}.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{ac-3.2_prm_1}}: organization-defined privileged commands and/or other organization-defined actions

securityControls.title: ac-3.3 - Mandatory Access Control
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ac-3.3_smt}}, Name: statement - Enforce {{ ac-3.3_prm_1 }} over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy:
    • item: {{ac-3.3_smt.a}} - Is uniformly enforced across the covered subjects and objects within the system;
    • item: {{ac-3.3_smt.b}} - Specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information is constrained from doing any of the following;
      • item: {{ac-3.3_smt.b.1}} - Passing the information to unauthorized subjects or objects;
      • item: {{ac-3.3_smt.b.2}} - Granting its privileges to other subjects;
      • item: {{ac-3.3_smt.b.3}} - Changing one or more security attributes (specified by the policy) on subjects, objects, the system, or system components;
      • item: {{ac-3.3_smt.b.4}} - Choosing the security attributes and attribute values (specified by the policy) to be associated with newly created or modified objects; and
      • item: {{ac-3.3_smt.b.5}} - Changing the rules governing access control; and
    • item: {{ac-3.3_smt.c}} - Specifies that {{ ac-3.3_prm_2 }} may explicitly be granted {{ ac-3.3_prm_3 }} such that they are not limited by any defined subset (or all) of the above constraints.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{ac-3.3_prm_1}}: organization-defined mandatory access control policy
{{ac-3.3_prm_2}}: organization-defined subjects
{{ac-3.3_prm_3}}: organization-defined privileges

securityControls.title: ac-3.4 - Discretionary Access Control
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ac-3.4_smt}}, Name: statement - Enforce {{ ac-3.4_prm_1 }} over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information can do one or more of the following:
    • item: {{ac-3.4_smt.a}} - Pass the information to any other subjects or objects;
    • item: {{ac-3.4_smt.b}} - Grant its privileges to other subjects;
    • item: {{ac-3.4_smt.c}} - Change security attributes on subjects, objects, the system, or the system’s components;
    • item: {{ac-3.4_smt.d}} - Choose the security attributes to be associated with newly created or revised objects; or
    • item: {{ac-3.4_smt.e}} - Change the rules governing access control.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{ac-3.4_prm_1}}: organization-defined discretionary access control policy

securityControls.title: ac-3.5 - Security-relevant Information
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ac-3.5_smt}}, Name: statement - Prevent access to {{ ac-3.5_prm_1 }} except during secure, non-operable system states.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{ac-3.5_prm_1}}: organization-defined security-relevant information

    • item: {{ac-3.9_smt.b}} - {{ ac-3.9_prm_3 }} are used to validate the appropriateness of the information designated for release.

securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ac-4.32_smt}}, Name: statement - When transferring information between different security domains, the process that transfers information between filter pipelines:
    • item: {{ac-4.32_smt.a}} - Does not filter message content;
    • item: {{ac-4.32_smt.b}} - Validates filtering metadata;
    • item: {{ac-4.32_smt.c}} - Ensures the content associated with the filtering metadata has successfully completed filtering; and
    • item: {{ac-4.32_smt.d}} - Transfers the content to the destination filter pipeline.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ac-8 - System Use Notification
securityControls.description:
• item: {{ac-8_smt.a}} - Display {{ ac-8_prm_1 }} to users before granting access to the system that provides privacy and security notices consistent with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines and state that:
      • item: {{ac-8_smt.a.1}} - Users are accessing a U.S. Government system;
      • item: {{ac-8_smt.a.2}} - System usage may be monitored, recorded, and subject to audit;
      • item: {{ac-8_smt.a.3}} - Unauthorized use of the system is prohibited and subject to criminal and civil penalties; and
      • item: {{ac-8_smt.a.4}} - Use of the system indicates consent to monitoring and recording;
    • item: {{ac-8_smt.b}} - Retain the notification message or banner on the screen until users acknowledge the usage conditions and take explicit actions to log on to or further access the system; and
    • item: {{ac-8_smt.c}} - For publicly accessible systems:
      • item: {{ac-8_smt.c.1}} - Display system use information {{ ac-8_prm_2 }}, before granting further access to the publicly accessible system;
      • item: {{ac-8_smt.c.2}} - Display references, if any, to monitoring, recording, or auditing that are consistent with privacy accommodations for such systems that generally prohibit those activities; and
      • item: {{ac-8_smt.c.3}} - Include a description of the authorized uses of the system.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{ac-8_prm_1}}: organization-defined system use notification message or banner
{{ac-8_prm_2}}: organization-defined conditions

ac-19.4 - Restrictions for Classified Information
securityControls.description:
• item: {{ac-19.4_smt.a}} - Prohibit the use of unclassified mobile devices in facilities containing systems processing, storing, or transmitting classified information unless specifically permitted by the authorizing official; and
    • item: {{ac-19.4_smt.b}} - Enforce the following restrictions on individuals permitted by the authorizing official to use unclassified mobile devices in facilities containing systems processing, storing, or transmitting classified information:
      • item: {{ac-19.4_smt.b.1}} - Connection of unclassified mobile devices to classified systems is prohibited;
      • item: {{ac-19.4_smt.b.2}} - Connection of unclassified mobile devices to unclassified systems requires approval from the authorizing official;
      • item: {{ac-19.4_smt.b.3}} - Use of internal or external modems or wireless interfaces within the unclassified mobile devices is prohibited; and
      • item: {{ac-19.4_smt.b.4}} - Unclassified mobile devices and the information stored on those devices are subject to random reviews and inspections by {{ ac-19.4_prm_1 }}, and if classified information is found, the incident handling policy is followed.
    • item: {{ac-19.4_smt.c}} - Restrict the connection of classified mobile devices to classified systems in accordance with {{ ac-19.4_prm_2 }}.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{ac-19.4_prm_1}}: organization-defined security officials
{{ac-19.4_prm_2}}: organization-defined security policies

    • item: {{ac-20.1_smt.a}} - Verification of the implementation of controls on the external system as specified in the organization’s security and privacy policies and security and privacy plans; or
    • item: {{ac-20.1_smt.b}} - Retention of approved system connection or processing agreements with the organizational entity hosting the external system.

securityControls.title: ca-1 - Policy and Procedures
securityControls.description:
• item: {{ca-1_smt.a}} - Develop, document, and disseminate to {{ ca-1_prm_1 }}:
      • item: {{ca-1_smt.a.1}} - {{ ca-1_prm_2 }} assessment, authorization, and monitoring policy that:
        • item: {{ca-1_smt.a.1.a}} - Addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
        • item: {{ca-1_smt.a.1.b}} - Is consistent with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines; and
      • item: {{ca-1_smt.a.2}} - Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the assessment, authorization, and monitoring policy and the associated assessment, authorization, and monitoring controls;
    • item: {{ca-1_smt.b}} - Designate an {{ ca-1_prm_3 }} to manage the development, documentation, and dissemination of the assessment, authorization, and monitoring policy and procedures; and
    • item: {{ca-1_smt.c}} - Review and update the current assessment, authorization, and monitoring:
      • item: {{ca-1_smt.c.1}} - Policy {{ ca-1_prm_4 }} and following {{ ca-1_prm_5 }}; and
      • item: {{ca-1_smt.c.2}} - Procedures {{ ca-1_prm_6 }} and following {{ ca-1_prm_7 }}.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ca-2 - Control Assessments
securityControls.description:
• item: {{ca-2_smt.a}} - Select the appropriate assessor or assessment team for the type of assessment to be conducted;
    • item: {{ca-2_smt.b}} - Develop a control assessment plan that describes the scope of the assessment including:
      • item: {{ca-2_smt.b.1}} - Controls and control enhancements under assessment;
      • item: {{ca-2_smt.b.2}} - Assessment procedures to be used to determine control effectiveness; and
      • item: {{ca-2_smt.b.3}} - Assessment environment, assessment team, and assessment roles and responsibilities;
    • item: {{ca-2_smt.c}} - Ensure the control assessment plan is reviewed and approved by the authorizing official or designated representative prior to conducting the assessment;
    • item: {{ca-2_smt.d}} - Assess the controls in the system and its environment of operation {{ ca-2_prm_1 }} to determine the extent to which the controls are implemented correctly, operating as intended, and producing the desired outcome with respect to meeting established security and privacy requirements;
    • item: {{ca-2_smt.e}} - Produce a control assessment report that document the results of the assessment; and
    • item: {{ca-2_smt.f}} - Provide the results of the control assessment to {{ ca-2_prm_2 }}.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ca-6 - Authorization
securityControls.description:
• item: {{ca-6_smt.a}} - Assign a senior official as the authorizing official for the system;
    • item: {{ca-6_smt.b}} - Assign a senior official as the authorizing official for common controls available for inheritance by organizational systems;
    • item: {{ca-6_smt.c}} - Ensure that the authorizing official for the system, before commencing operations:
      • item: {{ca-6_smt.c.1}} - Accepts the use of common controls inherited by the system; and
      • item: {{ca-6_smt.c.2}} - Authorizes the system to operate;
    • item: {{ca-6_smt.d}} - Ensure that the authorizing official for common controls authorizes the use of those controls for inheritance by organizational systems;
    • item: {{ca-6_smt.e}} - Update the authorizations {{ ca-6_prm_1 }}.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ca-7 - Continuous Monitoring
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ca-7_smt}}, Name: statement - Develop a system-level continuous monitoring strategy and implement continuous monitoring in accordance with the organization-level continuous monitoring strategy that includes:
    • item: {{ca-7_smt.a}} - Establishing the following system-level metrics to be monitored: {{ ca-7_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{ca-7_smt.b}} - Establishing {{ ca-7_prm_2 }} for monitoring and {{ ca-7_prm_3 }} for assessment of control effectiveness;
    • item: {{ca-7_smt.c}} - Ongoing control assessments in accordance with the continuous monitoring strategy;
    • item: {{ca-7_smt.d}} - Ongoing monitoring of system and organization-defined metrics in accordance with the continuous monitoring strategy;
    • item: {{ca-7_smt.e}} - Correlation and analysis of information generated by control assessments and monitoring;
    • item: {{ca-7_smt.f}} - Response actions to address results of the analysis of control assessment and monitoring information; and
    • item: {{ca-7_smt.g}} - Reporting the security and privacy status of the system to {{ ca-7_prm_4 }} {{ ca-7_prm_5 }}.


  • Guidance

• ID: {{ca-7.4_smt}}, Name: statement - Ensure risk monitoring is an integral part of the continuous monitoring strategy that includes the following:

    • item: {{ca-7.4_smt.c}} - Change monitoring.


  • Guidance

    • item: {{cm-3.1_smt.c}} - Highlight proposed changes to the system that have not been approved or disapproved within {{ cm-3.1_prm_3 }};
    • item: {{cm-3.1_smt.d}} - Prohibit changes to the system until designated approvals are received;
    • item: {{cm-3.1_smt.e}} - Document all changes to the system; and
    • item: {{cm-3.1_smt.f}} - Notify {{ cm-3.1_prm_4 }} when approved changes to the system are completed.

securityControls.title: cp-2 - Contingency Plan
securityControls.description:
• item: {{cp-2_smt.a}} - Develop a contingency plan for the system that:
      • item: {{cp-2_smt.a.1}} - Identifies essential mission and business functions and associated contingency requirements;
      • item: {{cp-2_smt.a.2}} - Provides recovery objectives, restoration priorities, and metrics;
      • item: {{cp-2_smt.a.3}} - Addresses contingency roles, responsibilities, assigned individuals with contact information;
      • item: {{cp-2_smt.a.4}} - Addresses maintaining essential mission and business functions despite a system disruption, compromise, or failure;
      • item: {{cp-2_smt.a.5}} - Addresses eventual, full system restoration without deterioration of the controls originally planned and implemented;
      • item: {{cp-2_smt.a.6}} - Addresses the sharing of contingency information; and
      • item: {{cp-2_smt.a.7}} - Is reviewed and approved by {{ cp-2_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{cp-2_smt.b}} - Distribute copies of the contingency plan to {{ cp-2_prm_2 }};
    • item: {{cp-2_smt.c}} - Coordinate contingency planning activities with incident handling activities;
    • item: {{cp-2_smt.d}} - Review the contingency plan for the system {{ cp-2_prm_3 }};
    • item: {{cp-2_smt.e}} - Update the contingency plan to address changes to the organization, system, or environment of operation and problems encountered during contingency plan implementation, execution, or testing;
    • item: {{cp-2_smt.f}} - Communicate contingency plan changes to {{ cp-2_prm_4 }};
    • item: {{cp-2_smt.g}} - Incorporate lessons learned from contingency plan testing, training, or actual contingency activities into contingency testing and training; and
    • item: {{cp-2_smt.h}} - Protect the contingency plan from unauthorized disclosure and modification.


  • Guidance

• item: {{cp-3_smt.a}} - Provide contingency training to system users consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities:
      • item: {{cp-3_smt.a.1}} - Within {{ cp-3_prm_1 }} of assuming a contingency role or responsibility;
      • item: {{cp-3_smt.a.2}} - When required by system changes; and
      • item: {{cp-3_smt.a.3}} - {{ cp-3_prm_2 }} thereafter; and
    • item: {{cp-3_smt.b}} - Review and update contingency training content {{ cp-3_prm_3 }} and following {{ cp-3_prm_4 }}.


  • Guidance

{{511f6832-23ca-49a3-8c0f-ce493373cab8}} - Wilson M, Hash J (2003) Building an Information Technology Security Awareness and Training Program. (National Institute of Standards and Technology, Gaithersburg, MD), NIST Special Publication (SP) 800-50.

securityControls.title: cp-3.1 - Simulated Events

• ID: {{cp-3.2_smt}}, Name: statement - Employ mechanisms used in operations to provide a more thorough and realistic contingency training environment.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: cp-4 - Contingency Plan Testing
securityControls.description:
• item: {{cp-4_smt.a}} - Test the contingency plan for the system {{ cp-4_prm_1 }} using the following tests to determine the effectiveness of the plan and the readiness to execute the plan: {{ cp-4_prm_2 }}.
    • item: {{cp-4_smt.b}} - Review the contingency plan test results; and
    • item: {{cp-4_smt.c}} - Initiate corrective actions, if needed.


  • Guidance

securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cp-4.2_smt}}, Name: statement - Test the contingency plan at the alternate processing site:
    • item: {{cp-4.2_smt.a}} - To familiarize contingency personnel with the facility and available resources; and
    • item: {{cp-4.2_smt.b}} - To evaluate the capabilities of the alternate processing site to support contingency operations.


  • Guidance

  • Guidance

securityControls.title: cp-6.1 - Separation from Primary Site
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cp-6.1_smt}}, Name: statement - Identify an alternate storage site that is sufficiently separated from the primary storage site to reduce susceptibility to the same threats.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: cp-6.2 - Recovery Time and Recovery Point Objectives
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cp-6.2_smt}}, Name: statement - Configure the alternate storage site to facilitate recovery operations in accordance with recovery time and recovery point objectives.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: cp-6.3 - Accessibility
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cp-6.3_smt}}, Name: statement - Identify potential accessibility problems to the alternate storage site in the event of an area-wide disruption or disaster and outline explicit mitigation actions.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: cp-7 - Alternate Processing Site
securityControls.description:
• item: {{cp-7_smt.a}} - Establish an alternate processing site, including necessary agreements to permit the transfer and resumption of {{ cp-7_prm_1 }} for essential mission and business functions within {{ cp-7_prm_2 }} when the primary processing capabilities are unavailable;
    • item: {{cp-7_smt.b}} - Make available at the alternate processing site, the equipment and supplies required to transfer and resume operations or put contracts in place to support delivery to the site within the organization-defined time period for transfer and resumption; and
    • item: {{cp-7_smt.c}} - Provide controls at the alternate processing site that are equivalent to those at the primary site.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: cp-8.1 - Priority of Service Provisions
securityControls.description:
• item: {{cp-8.1_smt.a}} - Develop primary and alternate telecommunications service agreements that contain priority-of-service provisions in accordance with availability requirements (including recovery time objectives); and
    • item: {{cp-8.1_smt.b}} - Request Telecommunications Service Priority for all telecommunications services used for national security emergency preparedness if the primary and/or alternate telecommunications services are provided by a common carrier.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: cp-8.2 - Single Points of Failure
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cp-8.2_smt}}, Name: statement - Obtain alternate telecommunications services to reduce the likelihood of sharing a single point of failure with primary telecommunications services.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: cp-8.3 - Separation of Primary and Alternate Providers
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{cp-8.3_smt}}, Name: statement - Obtain alternate telecommunications services from providers that are separated from primary service providers to reduce susceptibility to the same threats.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: cp-8.4 - Provider Contingency Plan
securityControls.description:
• item: {{cp-8.4_smt.a}} - Require primary and alternate telecommunications service providers to have contingency plans;
    • item: {{cp-8.4_smt.b}} - Review provider contingency plans to ensure that the plans meet organizational contingency requirements; and
    • item: {{cp-8.4_smt.c}} - Obtain evidence of contingency testing and training by providers {{ cp-8.4_prm_1 }}.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ia-1 - Policy and Procedures
securityControls.description:
• item: {{ia-1_smt.a}} - Develop, document, and disseminate to {{ ia-1_prm_1 }}:
      • item: {{ia-1_smt.a.1}} - {{ ia-1_prm_2 }} identification and authentication policy that:
        • item: {{ia-1_smt.a.1.a}} - Addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
        • item: {{ia-1_smt.a.1.b}} - Is consistent with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines; and
      • item: {{ia-1_smt.a.2}} - Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the identification and authentication policy and the associated identification and authentication controls;
    • item: {{ia-1_smt.b}} - Designate an {{ ia-1_prm_3 }} to manage the development, documentation, and dissemination of the identification and authentication policy and procedures; and
    • item: {{ia-1_smt.c}} - Review and update the current identification and authentication:
      • item: {{ia-1_smt.c.1}} - Policy {{ ia-1_prm_4 }} and following {{ ia-1_prm_5 }}; and
      • item: {{ia-1_smt.c.2}} - Procedures {{ ia-1_prm_6 }} and following {{ ia-1_prm_7 }}.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ia-2.6 - Access to Accounts — Separate Device

    • item: {{ia-2.6_smt.a}} - One of the factors is provided by a device separate from the system gaining access; and
    • item: {{ia-2.6_smt.b}} - The device meets {{ ia-2.6_prm_3 }}.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ia-5 - Authenticator Management
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ia-5_smt}}, Name: statement - Manage system authenticators by:
    • item: {{ia-5_smt.a}} - Verifying, as part of the initial authenticator distribution, the identity of the individual, group, role, service, or device receiving the authenticator;
    • item: {{ia-5_smt.b}} - Establishing initial authenticator content for any authenticators issued by the organization;
    • item: {{ia-5_smt.c}} - Ensuring that authenticators have sufficient strength of mechanism for their intended use;
    • item: {{ia-5_smt.d}} - Establishing and implementing administrative procedures for initial authenticator distribution, for lost or compromised or damaged authenticators, and for revoking authenticators;
    • item: {{ia-5_smt.e}} - Changing default authenticators prior to first use;
    • item: {{ia-5_smt.f}} - Changing or refreshing authenticators {{ ia-5_prm_1 }} or when {{ ia-5_prm_2 }} occur;
    • item: {{ia-5_smt.g}} - Protecting authenticator content from unauthorized disclosure and modification;
    • item: {{ia-5_smt.h}} - Requiring individuals to take, and having devices implement, specific controls to protect authenticators; and
    • item: {{ia-5_smt.i}} - Changing authenticators for group or role accounts when membership to those accounts changes.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ia-5.1 - Password-based Authentication
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ia-5.1_smt}}, Name: statement - For password-based authentication:
    • item: {{ia-5.1_smt.a}} - Maintain a list of commonly-used, expected, or compromised passwords and update the list {{ ia-5.1_prm_1 }} and when organizational passwords are suspected to have been compromised directly or indirectly;
    • item: {{ia-5.1_smt.b}} - Verify, when users create or update passwords, that the passwords are not found on the list of commonly-used, expected, or compromised passwords in IA-5(1)(a);
    • item: {{ia-5.1_smt.c}} - Transmit passwords only over cryptographically-protected channels;
    • item: {{ia-5.1_smt.d}} - Store passwords using an approved salted key derivation function, preferably using a keyed hash;
    • item: {{ia-5.1_smt.e}} - Require immediate selection of a new password upon account recovery;
    • item: {{ia-5.1_smt.f}} - Allow user selection of long passwords and passphrases, including spaces and all printable characters;
    • item: {{ia-5.1_smt.g}} - Employ automated tools to assist the user in selecting strong password authenticators; and
    • item: {{ia-5.1_smt.h}} - Enforce the following composition and complexity rules: {{ ia-5.1_prm_2 }}.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{ia-5.1_prm_1}}: organization-defined frequency
{{ia-5.1_prm_2}}: organization-defined composition and complexity rules

securityControls.title: ia-5.2 - Public Key-based Authentication
securityControls.description:
• item: {{ia-5.2_smt.a}} - For public key-based authentication:
      • item: {{ia-5.2_smt.a.1}} - Enforce authorized access to the corresponding private key; and
      • item: {{ia-5.2_smt.a.2}} - Map the authenticated identity to the account of the individual or group; and
    • item: {{ia-5.2_smt.b}} - When public key infrastructure (PKI) is used:
      • item: {{ia-5.2_smt.b.1}} - Validate certificates by constructing and verifying a certification path to an accepted trust anchor, including checking certificate status information; and
      • item: {{ia-5.2_smt.b.2}} - Implement a local cache of revocation data to support path discovery and validation.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ia-5.3 - In-person or Trusted External Party Registration
ia-5.4 - Automated Support for Password Strength Determination
ia-5.5 - Change Authenticators Prior to Delivery

securityControls.title: ia-5.6 - Protection of Authenticators
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ia-5.6_smt}}, Name: statement - Protect authenticators commensurate with the security category of the information to which use of the authenticator permits access.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ia-5.7 - No Embedded Unencrypted Static Authenticators

  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ir-1 - Policy and Procedures
securityControls.description:
• item: {{ir-1_smt.a}} - Develop, document, and disseminate to {{ ir-1_prm_1 }}:
      • item: {{ir-1_smt.a.1}} - {{ ir-1_prm_2 }} incident response policy that:
        • item: {{ir-1_smt.a.1.a}} - Addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
        • item: {{ir-1_smt.a.1.b}} - Is consistent with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines; and
      • item: {{ir-1_smt.a.2}} - Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the incident response policy and the associated incident response controls;
    • item: {{ir-1_smt.b}} - Designate an {{ ir-1_prm_3 }} to manage the development, documentation, and dissemination of the incident response policy and procedures; and
    • item: {{ir-1_smt.c}} - Review and update the current incident response:
      • item: {{ir-1_smt.c.1}} - Policy {{ ir-1_prm_4 }} and following {{ ir-1_prm_5 }}; and
      • item: {{ir-1_smt.c.2}} - Procedures {{ ir-1_prm_6 }} and following {{ ir-1_prm_7 }}.

securityControls.title: ir-4 - Incident Handling
securityControls.description:
• item: {{ir-4_smt.a}} - Implement an incident handling capability for incidents that is consistent with the incident response plan and includes preparation, detection and analysis, containment, eradication, and recovery;
    • item: {{ir-4_smt.b}} - Coordinate incident handling activities with contingency planning activities;
    • item: {{ir-4_smt.c}} - Incorporate lessons learned from ongoing incident handling activities into incident response procedures, training, and testing, and implement the resulting changes accordingly; and
    • item: {{ir-4_smt.d}} - Ensure the rigor, intensity, scope, and results of incident handling activities are comparable and predictable across the organization.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ir-8 - Incident Response Plan
securityControls.description:
• item: {{ir-8_smt.a}} - Develop an incident response plan that:
      • item: {{ir-8_smt.a.1}} - Provides the organization with a roadmap for implementing its incident response capability;
      • item: {{ir-8_smt.a.2}} - Describes the structure and organization of the incident response capability;
      • item: {{ir-8_smt.a.3}} - Provides a high-level approach for how the incident response capability fits into the overall organization;
      • item: {{ir-8_smt.a.4}} - Meets the unique requirements of the organization, which relate to mission, size, structure, and functions;
      • item: {{ir-8_smt.a.5}} - Defines reportable incidents;
      • item: {{ir-8_smt.a.6}} - Provides metrics for measuring the incident response capability within the organization;
      • item: {{ir-8_smt.a.7}} - Defines the resources and management support needed to effectively maintain and mature an incident response capability;
      • item: {{ir-8_smt.a.8}} - Addresses the sharing of incident information;
      • item: {{ir-8_smt.a.9}} - Is reviewed and approved by {{ ir-8_prm_1 }} {{ ir-8_prm_2 }}; and
      • item: {{ir-8_smt.a.10}} - Explicitly designates responsibility for incident response to {{ ir-8_prm_3 }}.
    • item: {{ir-8_smt.b}} - Distribute copies of the incident response plan to {{ ir-8_prm_4 }};
    • item: {{ir-8_smt.c}} - Update the incident response plan to address system and organizational changes or problems encountered during plan implementation, execution, or testing;
    • item: {{ir-8_smt.d}} - Communicate incident response plan changes to {{ ir-8_prm_5 }}; and
    • item: {{ir-8_smt.e}} - Protect the incident response plan from unauthorized disclosure and modification.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ir-8.1 - Breaches
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ir-8.1_smt}}, Name: statement - Include the following in the Incident Response Plan for breaches involving personally identifiable information:
    • item: {{ir-8.1_smt.a}} - A process to determine if notice to individuals or other organizations, including oversight organizations, is needed;
    • item: {{ir-8.1_smt.b}} - An assessment process to determine the extent of the harm, embarrassment, inconvenience, or unfairness to affected individuals and any mechanisms to mitigate such harms; and
    • item: {{ir-8.1_smt.c}} - Identification of applicable privacy requirements.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ir-9 - Information Spillage Response
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ir-9_smt}}, Name: statement - Respond to information spills by:
    • item: {{ir-9_smt.a}} - Assigning {{ ir-9_prm_1 }} with responsibility for responding to information spills;
    • item: {{ir-9_smt.b}} - Identifying the specific information involved in the system contamination;
    • item: {{ir-9_smt.c}} - Alerting {{ ir-9_prm_2 }} of the information spill using a method of communication not associated with the spill;
    • item: {{ir-9_smt.d}} - Isolating the contaminated system or system component;
    • item: {{ir-9_smt.e}} - Eradicating the information from the contaminated system or component;
    • item: {{ir-9_smt.f}} - Identifying other systems or system components that may have been subsequently contaminated; and
    • item: {{ir-9_smt.g}} - Performing the following additional actions: {{ ir-9_prm_3 }}.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ir-10 - Incident Analysis
ma-1 - Policy and Procedures
securityControls.description:
• item: {{ma-1_smt.a}} - Develop, document, and disseminate to {{ ma-1_prm_1 }}:
      • item: {{ma-1_smt.a.1}} - {{ ma-1_prm_2 }} maintenance policy that:
        • item: {{ma-1_smt.a.1.a}} - Addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
        • item: {{ma-1_smt.a.1.b}} - Is consistent with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines; and
      • item: {{ma-1_smt.a.2}} - Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the maintenance policy and the associated maintenance controls;
    • item: {{ma-1_smt.b}} - Designate an {{ ma-1_prm_3 }} to manage the development, documentation, and dissemination of the maintenance policy and procedures; and
    • item: {{ma-1_smt.c}} - Review and update the current maintenance:
      • item: {{ma-1_smt.c.1}} - Policy {{ ma-1_prm_4 }} and following {{ ma-1_prm_5 }}; and
      • item: {{ma-1_smt.c.2}} - Procedures {{ ma-1_prm_6 }} and following {{ ma-1_prm_7 }}.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ma-2 - Controlled Maintenance
securityControls.description:
• item: {{ma-2_smt.a}} - Schedule, document, and review records of maintenance, repair, and replacement on system components in accordance with manufacturer or vendor specifications and/or organizational requirements;
    • item: {{ma-2_smt.b}} - Approve and monitor all maintenance activities, whether performed on site or remotely and whether the system or system components are serviced on site or removed to another location;
    • item: {{ma-2_smt.c}} - Require that {{ ma-2_prm_1 }} explicitly approve the removal of the system or system components from organizational facilities for off-site maintenance, repair, or replacement;
    • item: {{ma-2_smt.d}} - Sanitize equipment to remove the following information from associated media prior to removal from organizational facilities for off-site maintenance, repair, or replacement: {{ ma-2_prm_2 }};
    • item: {{ma-2_smt.e}} - Check all potentially impacted controls to verify that the controls are still functioning properly following maintenance, repair, or replacement actions; and
    • item: {{ma-2_smt.f}} - Include the following information in organizational maintenance records: {{ ma-2_prm_3 }}.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ma-3.2 - Inspect Media
securityControls.description:

  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ma-3.3 - Prevent Unauthorized Removal
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ma-3.3_smt}}, Name: statement - Prevent the removal of maintenance equipment containing organizational information by:
    • item: {{ma-3.3_smt.a}} - Verifying that there is no organizational information contained on the equipment;
    • item: {{ma-3.3_smt.b}} - Sanitizing or destroying the equipment;
    • item: {{ma-3.3_smt.c}} - Retaining the equipment within the facility; or
    • item: {{ma-3.3_smt.d}} - Obtaining an exemption from {{ ma-3.3_prm_1 }} explicitly authorizing removal of the equipment from the facility.


  • Guidance

• item: {{ma-4_smt.a}} - Approve and monitor nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic activities;
    • item: {{ma-4_smt.b}} - Allow the use of nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic tools only as consistent with organizational policy and documented in the security plan for the system;
    • item: {{ma-4_smt.c}} - Employ strong authentication in the establishment of nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic sessions;
    • item: {{ma-4_smt.d}} - Maintain records for nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic activities; and
    • item: {{ma-4_smt.e}} - Terminate session and network connections when nonlocal maintenance is completed.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ma-4.1 - Logging and Review
securityControls.description:
• item: {{ma-4.1_smt.a}} - Log {{ ma-4.1_prm_1 }} for nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic sessions; and
    • item: {{ma-4.1_smt.b}} - Review the audit records of the maintenance and diagnostic sessions to detect anomalous behavior.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{ma-4.1_prm_1}}: organization-defined audit events

securityControls.title: ma-4.2 - Document Nonlocal Maintenance
ma-4.3 - Comparable Security and Sanitization
securityControls.description:
• item: {{ma-4.3_smt.a}} - Require that nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic services be performed from a system that implements a security capability comparable to the capability implemented on the system being serviced; or
    • item: {{ma-4.3_smt.b}} - Remove the component to be serviced from the system prior to nonlocal maintenance or diagnostic services; sanitize the component (for organizational information); and after the service is performed, inspect and sanitize the component (for potentially malicious software) before reconnecting the component to the system.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ma-4.4 - Authentication and Separation of Maintenance Sessions
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ma-4.4_smt}}, Name: statement - Protect nonlocal maintenance sessions by:
    • item: {{ma-4.4_smt.a}} - Employing {{ ma-4.4_prm_1 }}; and
    • item: {{ma-4.4_smt.b}} - Separating the maintenance sessions from other network sessions with the system by either:
      • item: {{ma-4.4_smt.b.1}} - Physically separated communications paths; or
      • item: {{ma-4.4_smt.b.2}} - Logically separated communications paths.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{ma-4.4_prm_1}}: organization-defined authenticators that are replay resistant

securityControls.title: ma-4.5 - Approvals and Notifications
securityControls.description:
• item: {{ma-4.5_smt.a}} - Require the approval of each nonlocal maintenance session by {{ ma-4.5_prm_1 }}; and
    • item: {{ma-4.5_smt.b}} - Notify the following personnel or roles of the date and time of planned nonlocal maintenance: {{ ma-4.5_prm_2 }}.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{ma-4.5_prm_1}}: organization-defined personnel or roles
{{ma-4.5_prm_2}}: organization-defined personnel or roles

securityControls.title: ma-4.6 - Cryptographic Protection
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ma-4.6_smt}}, Name: statement - Implement the following cryptographic mechanisms to protect the integrity and confidentiality of nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic communications: {{ ma-4.6_prm_1 }}.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{ma-4.6_prm_1}}: organization-defined cryptographic mechanisms

securityControls.title: ma-4.7 - Disconnect Verification
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ma-4.7_smt}}, Name: statement - Verify session and network connection termination after the completion of nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic sessions.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ma-5 - Maintenance Personnel
securityControls.description:
• item: {{ma-5_smt.a}} - Establish a process for maintenance personnel authorization and maintain a list of authorized maintenance organizations or personnel;
    • item: {{ma-5_smt.b}} - Verify that non-escorted personnel performing maintenance on the system possess the required access authorizations; and
    • item: {{ma-5_smt.c}} - Designate organizational personnel with required access authorizations and technical competence to supervise the maintenance activities of personnel who do not possess the required access authorizations.


  • Guidance
securityControls.enhancements:
Enhancements

  • {{ma-5.1}} - Individuals Without Appropriate Access
  • {{ma-5.2}} - Security Clearances for Classified Systems
  • {{ma-5.3}} - Citizenship Requirements for Classified Systems
  • {{ma-5.4}} - Foreign Nationals
  • {{ma-5.5}} - Non-system Maintenance

securityControls.title: ma-5.1 - Individuals Without Appropriate Access
securityControls.description:
• item: {{ma-5.1_smt.a}} - Implement procedures for the use of maintenance personnel that lack appropriate security clearances or are not U.S. citizens, that include the following requirements:
      • item: {{ma-5.1_smt.a.1}} - Maintenance personnel who do not have needed access authorizations, clearances, or formal access approvals are escorted and supervised during the performance of maintenance and diagnostic activities on the system by approved organizational personnel who are fully cleared, have appropriate access authorizations, and are technically qualified; and
      • item: {{ma-5.1_smt.a.2}} - Prior to initiating maintenance or diagnostic activities by personnel who do not have needed access authorizations, clearances or formal access approvals, all volatile information storage components within the system are sanitized and all nonvolatile storage media are removed or physically disconnected from the system and secured; and
    • item: {{ma-5.1_smt.b}} - Develop and implement {{ ma-5.1_prm_1 }} in the event a system component cannot be sanitized, removed, or disconnected from the system.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{ma-5.1_prm_1}}: organization-defined alternate controls

securityControls.title: ma-5.2 - Security Clearances for Classified Systems
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ma-5.2_smt}}, Name: statement - Verify that personnel performing maintenance and diagnostic activities on a system processing, storing, or transmitting classified information possess security clearances and formal access approvals for at least the highest classification level and for compartments of information on the system.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ma-5.3 - Citizenship Requirements for Classified Systems
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ma-5.3_smt}}, Name: statement - Verify that personnel performing maintenance and diagnostic activities on a system processing, storing, or transmitting classified information are U.S. citizens.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ma-5.4 - Foreign Nationals
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ma-5.4_smt}}, Name: statement - Ensure that:
    • item: {{ma-5.4_smt.a}} - Foreign nationals with appropriate security clearances are used to conduct maintenance and diagnostic activities on classified systems only when the systems are jointly owned and operated by the United States and foreign allied governments, or owned and operated solely by foreign allied governments; and
    • item: {{ma-5.4_smt.b}} - Approvals, consents, and detailed operational conditions regarding the use of foreign nationals to conduct maintenance and diagnostic activities on classified systems are fully documented within Memoranda of Agreements.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ma-5.5 - Non-system Maintenance
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ma-5.5_smt}}, Name: statement - Ensure that non-escorted personnel performing maintenance activities not directly associated with the system but in the physical proximity of the system, have required access authorizations.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ma-6 - Timely Maintenance
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ma-6_smt}}, Name: statement - Obtain maintenance support and/or spare parts for {{ ma-6_prm_1 }} within {{ ma-6_prm_2 }} of failure.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: mp-1 - Policy and Procedures
securityControls.description:
• item: {{mp-1_smt.a}} - Develop, document, and disseminate to {{ mp-1_prm_1 }}:
      • item: {{mp-1_smt.a.1}} - {{ mp-1_prm_2 }} media protection policy that:
        • item: {{mp-1_smt.a.1.a}} - Addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
        • item: {{mp-1_smt.a.1.b}} - Is consistent with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines; and
      • item: {{mp-1_smt.a.2}} - Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the media protection policy and the associated media protection controls;
    • item: {{mp-1_smt.b}} - Designate an {{ mp-1_prm_3 }} to manage the development, documentation, and dissemination of the media protection policy and procedures; and
    • item: {{mp-1_smt.c}} - Review and update the current media protection:
      • item: {{mp-1_smt.c.1}} - Policy {{ mp-1_prm_4 }} and following {{ mp-1_prm_5 }}; and
      • item: {{mp-1_smt.c.2}} - Procedures {{ mp-1_prm_6 }} and following {{ mp-1_prm_7 }}.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: pe-1 - Policy and Procedures
securityControls.description:
• item: {{pe-1_smt.a}} - Develop, document, and disseminate to {{ pe-1_prm_1 }}:
      • item: {{pe-1_smt.a.1}} - {{ pe-1_prm_2 }} physical and environmental protection policy that:
        • item: {{pe-1_smt.a.1.a}} - Addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
        • item: {{pe-1_smt.a.1.b}} - Is consistent with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines; and
      • item: {{pe-1_smt.a.2}} - Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the physical and environmental protection policy and the associated physical and environmental protection controls;
    • item: {{pe-1_smt.b}} - Designate an {{ pe-1_prm_3 }} to manage the development, documentation, and dissemination of the physical and environmental protection policy and procedures; and
    • item: {{pe-1_smt.c}} - Review and update the current physical and environmental protection:
      • item: {{pe-1_smt.c.1}} - Policy {{ pe-1_prm_4 }} and following {{ pe-1_prm_5 }}; and
      • item: {{pe-1_smt.c.2}} - Procedures {{ pe-1_prm_6 }} and following {{ pe-1_prm_7 }}.


  • Guidance

• item: {{pe-3_smt.a}} - Enforce physical access authorizations at {{ pe-3_prm_1 }} by:

    • item: {{pe-3_smt.b}} - Maintain physical access audit logs for {{ pe-3_prm_4 }};
    • item: {{pe-3_smt.c}} - Control access to areas within the facility designated as publicly accessible by implementing the following controls: {{ pe-3_prm_5 }};
    • item: {{pe-3_smt.d}} - Escort visitors and control visitor activity {{ pe-3_prm_6 }};
    • item: {{pe-3_smt.e}} - Secure keys, combinations, and other physical access devices;
    • item: {{pe-3_smt.f}} - Inventory {{ pe-3_prm_7 }} every {{ pe-3_prm_8 }}; and
    • item: {{pe-3_smt.g}} - Change combinations and keys {{ pe-3_prm_9 }} and/or when keys are lost, combinations are compromised, or when individuals possessing the keys or combinations are transferred or terminated.

securityControls.title: pl-2 - System Security and Privacy Plans
securityControls.description:
• item: {{pl-2_smt.a}} - Develop security and privacy plans for the system that:
      • item: {{pl-2_smt.a.1}} - Are consistent with the organization’s enterprise architecture;
      • item: {{pl-2_smt.a.2}} - Explicitly define the constituent system components;
      • item: {{pl-2_smt.a.3}} - Describe the operational context of the system in terms of mission and business processes;
      • item: {{pl-2_smt.a.4}} - Identify the individuals that fulfill system roles and responsibilities;
      • item: {{pl-2_smt.a.5}} - Identify the information types processed, stored, and transmitted by the system;
      • item: {{pl-2_smt.a.6}} - Provide the security categorization of the system, including supporting rationale;
      • item: {{pl-2_smt.a.7}} - Describe any specific threats to the system that are of concern to the organization;
      • item: {{pl-2_smt.a.8}} - Provide the results of a privacy risk assessment for systems processing personally identifiable information;
      • item: {{pl-2_smt.a.9}} - Describe the operational environment for the system and any dependencies on or connections to other systems or system components;
      • item: {{pl-2_smt.a.10}} - Provide an overview of the security and privacy requirements for the system;
      • item: {{pl-2_smt.a.11}} - Identify any relevant control baselines or overlays, if applicable;
      • item: {{pl-2_smt.a.12}} - Describe the controls in place or planned for meeting the security and privacy requirements, including a rationale for any tailoring decisions;
      • item: {{pl-2_smt.a.13}} - Include risk determinations for security and privacy architecture and design decisions;
      • item: {{pl-2_smt.a.14}} - Include security- and privacy-related activities affecting the system that require planning and coordination with {{ pl-2_prm_1 }}; and
      • item: {{pl-2_smt.a.15}} - Are reviewed and approved by the authorizing official or designated representative prior to plan implementation.
    • item: {{pl-2_smt.b}} - Distribute copies of the plans and communicate subsequent changes to the plans to {{ pl-2_prm_2 }};
    • item: {{pl-2_smt.c}} - Review the plans {{ pl-2_prm_3 }};
    • item: {{pl-2_smt.d}} - Update the plans to address changes to the system and environment of operation or problems identified during plan implementation or control assessments; and
    • item: {{pl-2_smt.e}} - Protect the plans from unauthorized disclosure and modification.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: pl-3 - System Security Plan Update
pl-4 - Rules of Behavior
securityControls.description:
• item: {{pl-4_smt.a}} - Establish and provide to individuals requiring access to the system, the rules that describe their responsibilities and expected behavior for information and system usage, security, and privacy;
    • item: {{pl-4_smt.b}} - Receive a documented acknowledgment from such individuals, indicating that they have read, understand, and agree to abide by the rules of behavior, before authorizing access to information and the system;
    • item: {{pl-4_smt.c}} - Review and update the rules of behavior {{ pl-4_prm_1 }}; and
    • item: {{pl-4_smt.d}} - Require individuals who have acknowledged a previous version of the rules of behavior to read and re-acknowledge {{ pl-4_prm_2 }}.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: pl-4.1 - Social Media and External Site/application Usage Restrictions
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{pl-4.1_smt}}, Name: statement - Include in the rules of behavior, restrictions on:
    • item: {{pl-4.1_smt.a}} - Use of social media, social networking sites, and external sites/applications;
    • item: {{pl-4.1_smt.b}} - Posting organizational information on public websites; and
    • item: {{pl-4.1_smt.c}} - Use of organization-provided identifiers (e.g., email addresses) and authentication secrets (e.g., passwords) for creating accounts on external sites/applications.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: pl-8 - Security and Privacy Architectures
securityControls.description:
• item: {{pl-8_smt.a}} - Develop security and privacy architectures for the system that:
      • item: {{pl-8_smt.a.1}} - Describe the requirements and approach to be taken for protecting the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of organizational information;
      • item: {{pl-8_smt.a.2}} - Describe the requirements and approach to be taken for processing personally identifiable information to minimize privacy risk to individuals;
      • item: {{pl-8_smt.a.3}} - Describe how the architectures are integrated into and support the enterprise architecture; and
      • item: {{pl-8_smt.a.4}} - Describe any assumptions about, and dependencies on, external systems and services;
    • item: {{pl-8_smt.b}} - Review and update the architectures {{ pl-8_prm_1 }} to reflect changes in the enterprise architecture; and
    • item: {{pl-8_smt.c}} - Reflect planned architecture changes in security and privacy plans, Concept of Operations (CONOPS), criticality analysis, organizational procedures, and procurements and acquisitions.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: pm-1 - Information Security Program Plan
securityControls.description:
• item: {{pm-1_smt.a}} - Develop and disseminate an organization-wide information security program plan that:
      • item: {{pm-1_smt.a.1}} - Provides an overview of the requirements for the security program and a description of the security program management controls and common controls in place or planned for meeting those requirements;
      • item: {{pm-1_smt.a.2}} - Includes the identification and assignment of roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance;
      • item: {{pm-1_smt.a.3}} - Reflects the coordination among organizational entities responsible for information security; and
      • item: {{pm-1_smt.a.4}} - Is approved by a senior official with responsibility and accountability for the risk being incurred to organizational operations (including mission, functions, image, and reputation), organizational assets, individuals, other organizations, and the Nation;
    • item: {{pm-1_smt.b}} - Review and update the organization-wide information security program plan {{ pm-1_prm_1 }} and following {{ pm-1_prm_2 }}; and
    • item: {{pm-1_smt.c}} - Protect the information security program plan from unauthorized disclosure and modification.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: pm-4 - Plan of Action and Milestones Process

      • item: {{pm-4_smt.a.2}} - Document the remedial information security, privacy, and supply chain risk management actions to adequately respond to risk to organizational operations and assets, individuals, other organizations, and the Nation; and
      • item: {{pm-4_smt.a.3}} - Are reported in accordance with established reporting requirements.
    • item: {{pm-4_smt.b}} - Review plans of action and milestones for consistency with the organizational risk management strategy and organization-wide priorities for risk response actions.

securityControls.title: pm-9 - Risk Management Strategy

      • item: {{pm-9_smt.a.1}} - Security risk to organizational operations and assets, individuals, other organizations, and the Nation associated with the operation and use of organizational systems; and
      • item: {{pm-9_smt.a.2}} - Privacy risk to individuals resulting from the authorized processing of personally identifiable information;
    • item: {{pm-9_smt.b}} - Implement the risk management strategy consistently across the organization; and
    • item: {{pm-9_smt.c}} - Review and update the risk management strategy {{ pm-9_prm_1 }} or as required, to address organizational changes.

securityControls.title: pm-18 - Privacy Program Plan
securityControls.description:
• item: {{pm-18_smt.a}} - Develop and disseminate an organization-wide privacy program plan that provides an overview of the agency’s privacy program, and:
      • item: {{pm-18_smt.a.1}} - Includes a description of the structure of the privacy program and the resources dedicated to the privacy program;
      • item: {{pm-18_smt.a.2}} - Provides an overview of the requirements for the privacy program and a description of the privacy program management controls and common controls in place or planned for meeting those requirements;
      • item: {{pm-18_smt.a.3}} - Includes the role of the senior agency official for privacy and the identification and assignment of roles of other privacy officials and staff and their responsibilities;
      • item: {{pm-18_smt.a.4}} - Describes management commitment, compliance, and the strategic goals and objectives of the privacy program;
      • item: {{pm-18_smt.a.5}} - Reflects coordination among organizational entities responsible for the different aspects of privacy; and
      • item: {{pm-18_smt.a.6}} - Is approved by a senior official with responsibility and accountability for the privacy risk being incurred to organizational operations (including mission, functions, image, and reputation), organizational assets, individuals, other organizations, and the Nation; and
    • item: {{pm-18_smt.b}} - Update the plan {{ pm-18_prm_1 }} and to address changes in federal privacy laws and policy and organizational changes and problems identified during plan implementation or privacy control assessments.


  • Guidance

securityControls.description:

    • item: {{pm-20_smt.a}} - Ensures that the public has access to information about organizational privacy activities and can communicate with its senior agency official for privacy;
    • item: {{pm-20_smt.b}} - Ensures that organizational privacy practices and reports are publicly available; and
    • item: {{pm-20_smt.c}} - Employs publicly facing email addresses and/or phone lines to enable the public to provide feedback and/or direct questions to privacy offices regarding privacy practices.


  • Guidance

securityControls.enhancements:
Enhancements

  • {{pm-20.1}} - Privacy Policies on Websites, Applications, and Digital Services

securityControls.title: pm-20.1 - Privacy Policies on Websites, Applications, and Digital Services
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{pm-20.1_smt}}, Name: statement - Develop and post privacy policies on all external-facing websites, mobile applications, and other digital services, that:
    • item: {{pm-20.1_smt.a}} - Are written in plain language and organized in a way that is easy to understand and navigate;
    • item: {{pm-20.1_smt.b}} - Provide information needed by the public to make an informed decision about whether and how to interact with the organization; and
    • item: {{pm-20.1_smt.c}} - Are updated whenever the organization makes a substantive change to the practices it describes and includes a time/date stamp to inform the public of the date of the most recent changes.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: pm-21 - Accounting of Disclosures
securityControls.description:
• item: {{pm-21_smt.a}} - Develop and maintain an accurate accounting of disclosures of personally identifiable information, including:
      • item: {{pm-21_smt.a.1}} - Date, nature, and purpose of each disclosure; and
      • item: {{pm-21_smt.a.2}} - Name and address, or other contact information of the individual or organization to which the disclosure was made;
    • item: {{pm-21_smt.b}} - Retain the accounting of disclosures for the length of the time the personally identifiable information is maintained or five years after the disclosure is made, whichever is longer; and
    • item: {{pm-21_smt.c}} - Make the accounting of disclosures available to the individual to whom the personally identifiable information relates upon request.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: pm-22 - Personally Identifiable Information Quality Management

    • item: {{pm-22_smt.b}} - Correcting or deleting inaccurate or outdated personally identifiable information;
    • item: {{pm-22_smt.c}} - Disseminating notice of corrected or deleted personally identifiable information to individuals or other appropriate entities; and
    • item: {{pm-22_smt.d}} - Appeals of adverse decisions on correction or deletion requests.

securityControls.title: ps-3.1 - Classified Information
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ps-3.1_smt}}, Name: statement - Verify that individuals accessing a system processing, storing, or transmitting classified information are cleared and indoctrinated to the highest classification level of the information to which they have access on the system.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ps-3.2 - Formal Indoctrination
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ps-3.2_smt}}, Name: statement - Verify that individuals accessing a system processing, storing, or transmitting types of classified information that require formal indoctrination, are formally indoctrinated for all the relevant types of information to which they have access on the system.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ps-3.3 - Information with Special Protective Measures
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ps-3.3_smt}}, Name: statement - Verify that individuals accessing a system processing, storing, or transmitting information requiring special protection:
    • item: {{ps-3.3_smt.a}} - Have valid access authorizations that are demonstrated by assigned official government duties; and
    • item: {{ps-3.3_smt.b}} - Satisfy {{ ps-3.3_prm_1 }}.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ps-4 - Personnel Termination
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ps-4_smt}}, Name: statement - Upon termination of individual employment:
    • item: {{ps-4_smt.a}} - Disable system access within {{ ps-4_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{ps-4_smt.b}} - Terminate or revoke any authenticators and credentials associated with the individual;
    • item: {{ps-4_smt.c}} - Conduct exit interviews that include a discussion of {{ ps-4_prm_2 }};
    • item: {{ps-4_smt.d}} - Retrieve all security-related organizational system-related property; and
    • item: {{ps-4_smt.e}} - Retain access to organizational information and systems formerly controlled by terminated individual.


  • Guidance

    • item: {{ps-7_smt.d}} - Require external providers to notify {{ ps-7_prm_1 }} of any personnel transfers or terminations of external personnel who possess organizational credentials and/or badges, or who have system privileges within {{ ps-7_prm_2 }}; and
    • item: {{ps-7_smt.e}} - Monitor provider compliance with personnel security requirements.


  • Guidance

    • item: {{pt-5_smt.a}} - Is available to individuals upon first interacting with an organization, and subsequently at {{ pt-5_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{pt-5_smt.b}} - Is clear and easy-to-understand, expressing information about personally identifiable information processing in plain language;
    • item: {{pt-5_smt.c}} - Identifies the authority that authorizes the processing of personally identifiable information;
    • item: {{pt-5_smt.d}} - Identifies the purposes for which personally identifiable information is to be processed; and
    • item: {{pt-5_smt.e}} - Includes {{ pt-5_prm_2 }}.

securityControls.family: Personally Identifiable Information Processing and Transparency
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{pt-7_prm_1}}: organization-defined processing conditions

securityControls.title: pt-7.1 - Social Security Numbers
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{pt-7.1_smt}}, Name: statement - When a system processes Social Security numbers:
    • item: {{pt-7.1_smt.a}} - Eliminate unnecessary collection, maintenance, and use of Social Security numbers, and explore alternatives to their use as a personal identifier;
    • item: {{pt-7.1_smt.b}} - Do not deny any individual any right, benefit, or privilege provided by law because of such individual’s refusal to disclose his or her Social Security number; and
    • item: {{pt-7.1_smt.c}} - Inform any individual who is asked to disclose his or her Social Security number whether that disclosure is mandatory or voluntary, by what statutory or other authority such number is solicited, and what uses will be made of it.


  • Guidance
securityControls.family: Personally Identifiable Information Processing and Transparency

securityControls.title: pt-7.2 - First Amendment Information
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{pt-7.2_smt}}, Name: statement - Prohibit the processing of information describing how any individual exercises rights guaranteed by the First Amendment unless expressly authorized by statute or by the individual or unless pertinent to and within the scope of an authorized law enforcement activity.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: pt-8 - Computer Matching Requirements
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{pt-8_smt}}, Name: statement - When a system or organization processes information for the purpose of conducting a matching program:
    • item: {{pt-8_smt.a}} - Obtain approval from the Data Integrity Board to conduct the matching program;
    • item: {{pt-8_smt.b}} - Develop and enter into a computer matching agreement;
    • item: {{pt-8_smt.c}} - Publish a matching notice in the Federal Register;
    • item: {{pt-8_smt.d}} - Independently verify the information produced by the matching program before taking adverse action against an individual, if required; and
    • item: {{pt-8_smt.e}} - Provide individuals with notice and an opportunity to contest the findings before taking adverse action against an individual.


  • Guidance

securityControls.description:
• item: {{ra-1_smt.a}} - Develop, document, and disseminate to {{ ra-1_prm_1 }}:
      • item: {{ra-1_smt.a.1}} - {{ ra-1_prm_2 }} risk assessment policy that:
        • item: {{ra-1_smt.a.1.a}} - Addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
        • item: {{ra-1_smt.a.1.b}} - Is consistent with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines; and
      • item: {{ra-1_smt.a.2}} - Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the risk assessment policy and the associated risk assessment controls;
    • item: {{ra-1_smt.b}} - Designate an {{ ra-1_prm_3 }} to manage the development, documentation, and dissemination of the risk assessment policy and procedures; and
    • item: {{ra-1_smt.c}} - Review and update the current risk assessment:
      • item: {{ra-1_smt.c.1}} - Policy {{ ra-1_prm_4 }} and following {{ ra-1_prm_5 }}; and
      • item: {{ra-1_smt.c.2}} - Procedures {{ ra-1_prm_6 }} and following {{ ra-1_prm_7 }}.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ra-3 - Risk Assessment
securityControls.description:
• item: {{ra-3_smt.a}} - Conduct a risk assessment, including:
      • item: {{ra-3_smt.a.1}} - Identifying threats to and vulnerabilities in the system;
      • item: {{ra-3_smt.a.2}} - Determining the likelihood and magnitude of harm from unauthorized access, use, disclosure, disruption, modification, or destruction of the system, the information it processes, stores, or transmits, and any related information; and
      • item: {{ra-3_smt.a.3}} - Determining the likelihood and impact of adverse effects on individuals arising from the processing of personally identifiable information;
    • item: {{ra-3_smt.b}} - Integrate risk assessment results and risk management decisions from the organization and mission or business process perspectives with system-level risk assessments;
    • item: {{ra-3_smt.c}} - Document risk assessment results in {{ ra-3_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{ra-3_smt.d}} - Review risk assessment results {{ ra-3_prm_3 }};
    • item: {{ra-3_smt.e}} - Disseminate risk assessment results to {{ ra-3_prm_4 }}; and
    • item: {{ra-3_smt.f}} - Update the risk assessment {{ ra-3_prm_5 }} or when there are significant changes to the system, its environment of operation, or other conditions that may impact the security or privacy state of the system.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ra-4 - Risk Assessment Update
ra-5 - Vulnerability Monitoring and Scanning
securityControls.description:
• item: {{ra-5_smt.a}} - Monitor and scan for vulnerabilities in the system and hosted applications {{ ra-5_prm_1 }} and when new vulnerabilities potentially affecting the system are identified and reported;
    • item: {{ra-5_smt.b}} - Employ vulnerability monitoring tools and techniques that facilitate interoperability among tools and automate parts of the vulnerability management process by using standards for:
      • item: {{ra-5_smt.b.1}} - Enumerating platforms, software flaws, and improper configurations;
      • item: {{ra-5_smt.b.2}} - Formatting checklists and test procedures; and
      • item: {{ra-5_smt.b.3}} - Measuring vulnerability impact;
    • item: {{ra-5_smt.c}} - Analyze vulnerability scan reports and results from vulnerability monitoring;
    • item: {{ra-5_smt.d}} - Remediate legitimate vulnerabilities {{ ra-5_prm_2 }} in accordance with an organizational assessment of risk;
    • item: {{ra-5_smt.e}} - Share information obtained from the vulnerability monitoring process and control assessments with {{ ra-5_prm_3 }} to help eliminate similar vulnerabilities in other systems; and
    • item: {{ra-5_smt.f}} - Employ vulnerability monitoring tools that include the capability to readily update the vulnerabilities to be scanned.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: ra-8 - Privacy Impact Assessments
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{ra-8_smt}}, Name: statement - Conduct privacy impact assessments for systems, programs, or other activities before:
    • item: {{ra-8_smt.a}} - Developing or procuring information technology that processes personally identifiable information; and
    • item: {{ra-8_smt.b}} - Initiating a new collection of personally identifiable information that:
      • item: {{ra-8_smt.b.1}} - Will be processed using information technology; and
      • item: {{ra-8_smt.b.2}} - Includes personally identifiable information permitting the physical or virtual (online) contacting of a specific individual, if identical questions have been posed to, or identical reporting requirements imposed on, ten or more individuals, other than agencies, instrumentalities, or employees of the federal government.


  • Guidance

securityControls.description:
• item: {{sa-3.2_smt.a}} - Approve, document, and control the use of live data in preproduction environments for the system, system component, or system service; and
    • item: {{sa-3.2_smt.b}} - Protect preproduction environments for the system, system component, or system service at the same impact or classification level as any live data in use within the preproduction environments.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-3.3 - Technology Refresh
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-3.3_smt}}, Name: statement - Plan for and implement a technology refresh schedule for the system throughout the system development life cycle.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-4 - Acquisition Process
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-4_smt}}, Name: statement - Include the following requirements, descriptions, and criteria, explicitly or by reference, using {{ sa-4_prm_1 }} in the acquisition contract for the system, system component, or system service:
    • item: {{sa-4_smt.a}} - Security and privacy functional requirements;
    • item: {{sa-4_smt.b}} - Strength of mechanism requirements;
    • item: {{sa-4_smt.c}} - Security and privacy assurance requirements;
    • item: {{sa-4_smt.d}} - Controls needed to satisfy the security and privacy requirements.
    • item: {{sa-4_smt.e}} - Security and privacy documentation requirements;
    • item: {{sa-4_smt.f}} - Requirements for protecting security and privacy documentation;
    • item: {{sa-4_smt.g}} - Description of the system development environment and environment in which the system is intended to operate;
    • item: {{sa-4_smt.h}} - Allocation of responsibility or identification of parties responsible for information security, privacy, and supply chain risk management; and
    • item: {{sa-4_smt.i}} - Acceptance criteria.


  • Guidance
