securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
sa-4_prm_1, How Many: one or morestandardized contract language, {{ sa-4_prm_2 }} ,
{{sa-4_prm_2}}: organization-defined contract language

securityControls.title: sa-4.1 - Functional Properties of Controls
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-4.1_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to provide a description of the functional properties of the controls to be implemented.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-4.2 - Design and Implementation Information for Controls
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-4.2_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to provide design and implementation information for the controls that includes: {{ sa-4.2_prm_1 }} at {{ sa-4.2_prm_3 }}.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
sa-4.2_prm_1, How Many: one or moresecurity-relevant external system interfaces, high-level design, low-level design, source code or hardware schematics, {{ sa-4.2_prm_2 }} ,
{{sa-4.2_prm_2}}: organization-defined design and implementation information
{{sa-4.2_prm_3}}: organization-defined level of detail

securityControls.title: sa-4.3 - Development Methods, Techniques, and Practices
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-4.3_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to demonstrate the use of a system development life cycle process that includes:
    • item: {{sa-4.3_smt.a}} - {{ sa-4.3_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{sa-4.3_smt.b}} - organization-defined {{ sa-4.3_prm_2 }}; and
    • item: {{sa-4.3_smt.c}} - {{ sa-4.3_prm_3 }}.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{sa-4.3_prm_1}}: organization-defined systems engineering methods
sa-4.3_prm_2, How Many: one or moresystems security, privacy<#:assign> engineering methods,
{{sa-4.3_prm_3}}: organization-defined software development methods; testing, evaluation, assessment, verification, and validation methods; and quality control processes

securityControls.title: sa-4.4 - Assignment of Components to Systems
sa-4.5 - System, Component, and Service Configurations
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-4.5_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to:
    • item: {{sa-4.5_smt.a}} - Deliver the system, component, or service with {{ sa-4.5_prm_1 }} implemented; and
    • item: {{sa-4.5_smt.b}} - Use the configurations as the default for any subsequent system, component, or service reinstallation or upgrade.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{sa-4.5_prm_1}}: organization-defined security configurations

securityControls.title: sa-4.6 - Use of Information Assurance Products
securityControls.description:
• item: {{sa-4.6_smt.a}} - Employ only government off-the-shelf or commercial off-the-shelf information assurance and information assurance-enabled information technology products that compose an NSA-approved solution to protect classified information when the networks used to transmit the information are at a lower classification level than the information being transmitted; and
    • item: {{sa-4.6_smt.b}} - Ensure that these products have been evaluated and/or validated by NSA or in accordance with NSA-approved procedures.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-4.7 - Niap-approved Protection Profiles
securityControls.description:
• item: {{sa-4.7_smt.a}} - Limit the use of commercially provided information assurance and information assurance-enabled information technology products to those products that have been successfully evaluated against a National Information Assurance partnership (NIAP)-approved Protection Profile for a specific technology type, if such a profile exists; and
    • item: {{sa-4.7_smt.b}} - Require, if no NIAP-approved Protection Profile exists for a specific technology type but a commercially provided information technology product relies on cryptographic functionality to enforce its security policy, that the cryptographic module is FIPS-validated or NSA-approved.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-4.8 - Continuous Monitoring Plan for Controls
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-4.8_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to produce a plan for continuous monitoring of control effectiveness that is consistent with the continuous monitoring program of the organization.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-4.9 - Functions, Ports, Protocols, and Services in Use
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-4.9_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to identify the functions, ports, protocols, and services intended for organizational use.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-4.10 - Use of Approved Piv Products
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-4.10_smt}}, Name: statement - Employ only information technology products on the FIPS 201-approved products list for Personal Identity Verification (PIV) capability implemented within organizational systems.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-4.11 - System of Records
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-4.11_smt}}, Name: statement - Include {{ sa-4.11_prm_1 }} in the acquisition contract for the operation of a system of records on behalf of an organization to accomplish an organizational mission or function.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{sa-4.11_prm_1}}: organization-defined Privacy Act requirements

securityControls.title: sa-4.12 - Data Ownership
securityControls.description:
• item: {{sa-4.12_smt.a}} - Include organizational data ownership requirements in the acquisition contract; and
    • item: {{sa-4.12_smt.b}} - Require all data to be removed from the contractor’s system and returned to the organization within {{ sa-4.12_prm_1 }}.


  • Guidance

Parameters
{{sa-4.12_prm_1}}: organization-defined time frame

securityControls.title: sa-5 - System Documentation
securityControls.description:
• item: {{sa-5_smt.a}} - Obtain or develop administrator documentation for the system, system component, or system service that describes:
      • item: {{sa-5_smt.a.1}} - Secure configuration, installation, and operation of the system, component, or service;
      • item: {{sa-5_smt.a.2}} - Effective use and maintenance of security and privacy functions and mechanisms; and
      • item: {{sa-5_smt.a.3}} - Known vulnerabilities regarding configuration and use of administrative or privileged functions;
    • item: {{sa-5_smt.b}} - Obtain or develop user documentation for the system, system component, or system service that describes:
      • item: {{sa-5_smt.b.1}} - User-accessible security and privacy functions and mechanisms and how to effectively use those functions and mechanisms;
      • item: {{sa-5_smt.b.2}} - Methods for user interaction, which enables individuals to use the system, component, or service in a more secure manner and protect individual privacy; and
      • item: {{sa-5_smt.b.3}} - User responsibilities in maintaining the security of the system, component, or service and privacy of individuals;
    • item: {{sa-5_smt.c}} - Document attempts to obtain system, system component, or system service documentation when such documentation is either unavailable or nonexistent and take {{ sa-5_prm_1 }} in response; and
    • item: {{sa-5_smt.d}} - Distribute documentation to {{ sa-5_prm_2 }}.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-9 - External System Services
securityControls.description:
• item: {{sa-9_smt.a}} - Require that providers of external system services comply with organizational security and privacy requirements and employ the following controls: {{ sa-9_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{sa-9_smt.b}} - Define and document organizational oversight and user roles and responsibilities with regard to external system services; and
    • item: {{sa-9_smt.c}} - Employ the following processes, methods, and techniques to monitor control compliance by external service providers on an ongoing basis: {{ sa-9_prm_2 }}.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-9.1 - Risk Assessments and Organizational Approvals
securityControls.description:
• item: {{sa-9.1_smt.a}} - Conduct an organizational assessment of risk prior to the acquisition or outsourcing of information security services; and
    • item: {{sa-9.1_smt.b}} - Verify that the acquisition or outsourcing of dedicated information security services is approved by {{ sa-9.1_prm_1 }}.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{sa-9.1_prm_1}}: organization-defined personnel or roles

securityControls.title: sa-9.2 - Identification of Functions, Ports, Protocols, and Services
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-9.2_smt}}, Name: statement - Require providers of the following external system services to identify the functions, ports, protocols, and other services required for the use of such services: {{ sa-9.2_prm_1 }}.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{sa-9.2_prm_1}}: organization-defined external system services

securityControls.title: sa-9.3 - Establish and Maintain Trust Relationship with Providers
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-9.3_smt}}, Name: statement - Establish, document, and maintain trust relationships with external service providers based on the following requirements, properties, factors, or conditions: {{ sa-9.3_prm_1 }}.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{sa-9.3_prm_1}}: organization-defined security and privacy requirements, properties, factors, or conditions defining acceptable trust relationships

securityControls.title: sa-9.4 - Consistent Interests of Consumers and Providers
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-9.4_smt}}, Name: statement - Take the following actions to verify that the interests of {{ sa-9.4_prm_1 }} are consistent with and reflect organizational interests: {{ sa-9.4_prm_2 }}.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{sa-9.4_prm_1}}: organization-defined external service providers
{{sa-9.4_prm_2}}: organization-defined actions

securityControls.title: sa-9.5 - Processing, Storage, and Service Location
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-9.5_smt}}, Name: statement - Restrict the location of {{ sa-9.5_prm_1 }} to {{ sa-9.5_prm_2 }} based on {{ sa-9.5_prm_3 }}.


  • Guidance

Parameters
sa-9.5_prm_1, How Many: one or moreinformation processing, information or data, system services,
{{sa-9.5_prm_2}}: organization-defined locations
{{sa-9.5_prm_3}}: organization-defined requirements or conditions

securityControls.title: sa-9.6 - Organization-controlled Cryptographic Keys
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-9.6_smt}}, Name: statement - Maintain exclusive control of cryptographic keys for encrypted material stored or transmitted through an external system.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-9.7 - Organization-controlled Integrity Checking
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-9.7_smt}}, Name: statement - Provide the capability to check the integrity of information while it resides in the external system.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-9.8 - Processing and Storage Location — U.s. Jurisdiction
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-9.8_smt}}, Name: statement - Restrict the geographic location of information processing and data storage to facilities located within in the legal jurisdictional boundary of the United States.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-10 - Developer Configuration Management
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-10_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to:
    • item: {{sa-10_smt.a}} - Perform configuration management during system, component, or service {{ sa-10_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{sa-10_smt.b}} - Document, manage, and control the integrity of changes to {{ sa-10_prm_2 }};
    • item: {{sa-10_smt.c}} - Implement only organization-approved changes to the system, component, or service;
    • item: {{sa-10_smt.d}} - Document approved changes to the system, component, or service and the potential security and privacy impacts of such changes; and
    • item: {{sa-10_smt.e}} - Track security flaws and flaw resolution within the system, component, or service and report findings to {{ sa-10_prm_3 }}.


  • Guidance

  • {{sa-10.2}} - Alternative Configuration Management
  • {{sa-10.3}} - Hardware Integrity Verification
  • {{sa-10.4}} - Trusted Generation

securityControls.title: sa-10.1 - Software and Firmware Integrity Verification
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-10.1_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to enable integrity verification of software and firmware components.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-10.2 - Alternative Configuration Management
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-10.2_smt}}, Name: statement - Provide an alternate configuration management process using organizational personnel in the absence of a dedicated developer configuration management team.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-10.3 - Hardware Integrity Verification
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-10.3_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to enable integrity verification of hardware components.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-10.4 - Trusted Generation
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-10.4_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to employ tools for comparing newly generated versions of security-relevant hardware descriptions, source code, and object code with previous versions.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-10.5 - Mapping Integrity for Version Control
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-10.5_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to maintain the integrity of the mapping between the master build data describing the current version of security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware and the on-site master copy of the data for the current version.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-10.6 - Trusted Distribution
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-10.6_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to execute procedures for ensuring that security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware updates distributed to the organization are exactly as specified by the master copies.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-10.7 - Security and Privacy Representatives
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-10.7_smt}}, Name: statement - Require {{ sa-10.7_prm_1 }} to be included in the {{ sa-10.7_prm_2 }}.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-11 - Developer Testing and Evaluation
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-11_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service, at all post-design stages of the system development life cycle, to:
    • item: {{sa-11_smt.a}} - Develop and implement a plan for ongoing security and privacy assessments;
    • item: {{sa-11_smt.b}} - Perform {{ sa-11_prm_1 }} testing/evaluation {{ sa-11_prm_2 }} at {{ sa-11_prm_3 }};
    • item: {{sa-11_smt.c}} - Produce evidence of the execution of the assessment plan and the results of the testing and evaluation;
    • item: {{sa-11_smt.d}} - Implement a verifiable flaw remediation process; and
    • item: {{sa-11_smt.e}} - Correct flaws identified during testing and evaluation.


  • Guidance
securityControls.references:

  • {{sa-11.4}} - Manual Code Reviews

securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
sa-11_prm_1, How Many: one or moreunit, integration, system, regression,
{{sa-11_prm_2}}: organization-defined frequency
{{sa-11_prm_3}}: organization-defined depth and coverage

securityControls.title: sa-11.1 - Static Code Analysis
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-11.1_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to employ static code analysis tools to identify common flaws and document the results of the analysis.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-11.2 - Threat Modeling and Vulnerability Analyses
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-11.2_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to perform threat modeling and vulnerability analyses during development and the subsequent testing and evaluation of the system, component, or service that:
    • item: {{sa-11.2_smt.a}} - Uses the following contextual information: {{ sa-11.2_prm_1 }};
    • item: {{sa-11.2_smt.b}} - Employs the following tools and methods: {{ sa-11.2_prm_2 }};
    • item: {{sa-11.2_smt.c}} - Conducts the modeling and analyses at the following level of rigor: {{ sa-11.2_prm_3 }}; and
    • item: {{sa-11.2_smt.d}} - Produces evidence that meets the following acceptance criteria: {{ sa-11.2_prm_4 }}.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{sa-11.2_prm_1}}: organization-defined information concerning impact, environment of operations, known or assumed threats, and acceptable risk levels
{{sa-11.2_prm_2}}: organization-defined tools and methods
{{sa-11.2_prm_3}}: organization-defined breadth and depth of modeling and analyses
{{sa-11.2_prm_4}}: organization-defined acceptance criteria

securityControls.title: sa-11.3 - Independent Verification of Assessment Plans and Evidence
securityControls.description:
• item: {{sa-11.3_smt.a}} - Require an independent agent satisfying {{ sa-11.3_prm_1 }} to verify the correct implementation of the developer security and privacy assessment plans and the evidence produced during testing and evaluation; and
    • item: {{sa-11.3_smt.b}} - Verify that the independent agent is provided with sufficient information to complete the verification process or granted the authority to obtain such information.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{sa-11.3_prm_1}}: organization-defined independence criteria

securityControls.title: sa-11.4 - Manual Code Reviews
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-11.4_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to perform a manual code review of {{ sa-11.4_prm_1 }} using the following processes, procedures, and/or techniques: {{ sa-11.4_prm_2 }}.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{sa-11.4_prm_1}}: organization-defined specific code
{{sa-11.4_prm_2}}: organization-defined processes, procedures, and/or techniques

securityControls.title: sa-11.5 - Penetration Testing
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-11.5_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to perform penetration testing:
    • item: {{sa-11.5_smt.a}} - At the following level of rigor: {{ sa-11.5_prm_1 }}; and
    • item: {{sa-11.5_smt.b}} - Under the following constraints: {{ sa-11.5_prm_2 }}.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{sa-11.5_prm_1}}: organization-defined breadth and depth of testing
{{sa-11.5_prm_2}}: organization-defined constraints

securityControls.title: sa-11.6 - Attack Surface Reviews
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-11.6_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to perform attack surface reviews.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-11.7 - Verify Scope of Testing and Evaluation
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-11.7_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to verify that the scope of testing and evaluation provides complete coverage of the required controls at the following level of rigor: {{ sa-11.7_prm_1 }}.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{sa-11.7_prm_1}}: organization-defined breadth and depth of testing and evaluation

securityControls.title: sa-11.8 - Dynamic Code Analysis
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-11.8_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to employ dynamic code analysis tools to identify common flaws and document the results of the analysis.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-11.9 - Interactive Application Security Testing
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-11.9_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to employ interactive application security testing tools to identify flaws and document the results.


  • Guidance

sa-15 - Development Process, Standards, and Tools
securityControls.description:
• item: {{sa-15_smt.a}} - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to follow a documented development process that:
      • item: {{sa-15_smt.a.1}} - Explicitly addresses security and privacy requirements;
      • item: {{sa-15_smt.a.2}} - Identifies the standards and tools used in the development process;
      • item: {{sa-15_smt.a.3}} - Documents the specific tool options and tool configurations used in the development process; and
      • item: {{sa-15_smt.a.4}} - Documents, manages, and ensures the integrity of changes to the process and/or tools used in development; and
    • item: {{sa-15_smt.b}} - Review the development process, standards, tools, tool options, and tool configurations {{ sa-15_prm_1 }} to determine if the process, standards, tools, tool options and tool configurations selected and employed can satisfy the following security and privacy requirements: {{ sa-15_prm_2 }}.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-15.1 - Quality Metrics
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-15.1_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to:
    • item: {{sa-15.1_smt.a}} - Define quality metrics at the beginning of the development process; and
    • item: {{sa-15.1_smt.b}} - Provide evidence of meeting the quality metrics {{ sa-15.1_prm_1 }}.

{{sa-15.1_prm_3}}: organization-defined program review milestones

securityControls.title: sa-15.2 - Security and Privacy Tracking Tools
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-15.2_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to select and employ security and privacy tracking tools for use during the development process.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-15.3 - Criticality Analysis
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-15.3_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to perform a criticality analysis:
    • item: {{sa-15.3_smt.a}} - At the following decision points in the system development life cycle: {{ sa-15.3_prm_1 }}; and
    • item: {{sa-15.3_smt.b}} - At the following level of rigor: {{ sa-15.3_prm_2 }}.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{sa-15.3_prm_1}}: organization-defined decision points in the system development life cycle
{{sa-15.3_prm_2}}: organization-defined breadth and depth of criticality analysis

sa-15.5 - Attack Surface Reduction
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-15.5_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to reduce attack surfaces to {{ sa-15.5_prm_1 }}.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{sa-15.5_prm_1}}: organization-defined thresholds

securityControls.title: sa-15.6 - Continuous Improvement
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-15.6_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to implement an explicit process to continuously improve the development process.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-15.7 - Automated Vulnerability Analysis
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-15.7_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service {{ sa-15.7_prm_1 }} to:
    • item: {{sa-15.7_smt.a}} - Perform an automated vulnerability analysis using {{ sa-15.7_prm_2 }};
    • item: {{sa-15.7_smt.b}} - Determine the exploitation potential for discovered vulnerabilities;
    • item: {{sa-15.7_smt.c}} - Determine potential risk mitigations for delivered vulnerabilities; and
    • item: {{sa-15.7_smt.d}} - Deliver the outputs of the tools and results of the analysis to {{ sa-15.7_prm_3 }}.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{sa-15.7_prm_1}}: organization-defined frequency
{{sa-15.7_prm_2}}: organization-defined tools
{{sa-15.7_prm_3}}: organization-defined personnel or roles

securityControls.title: sa-15.8 - Reuse of Threat and Vulnerability Information
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-15.8_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to use threat modeling and vulnerability analyses from similar systems, components, or services to inform the current development process.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-15.9 - Use of Live Data
sa-15.10 - Incident Response Plan
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-15.10_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to provide, implement, and test an incident response plan.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-15.11 - Archive System or Component
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-15.11_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system or system component to archive the system or component to be released or delivered together with the corresponding evidence supporting the final security and privacy review.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-15.12 - Minimize Personally Identifiable Information
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-15.12_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system or system component to minimize the use of personally identifiable information in development and test environments.


  • Guidance

securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-16_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to provide the following training on the correct use and operation of the implemented security and privacy functions, controls, and/or mechanisms: {{ sa-16_prm_1 }}.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-17 - Developer Security and Privacy Architecture and Design
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-17_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to produce a design specification and security and privacy architecture that:
    • item: {{sa-17_smt.a}} - Is consistent with the organization’s security and privacy architecture that is an integral part the organization’s enterprise architecture;
    • item: {{sa-17_smt.b}} - Accurately and completely describes the required security and privacy functionality, and the allocation of controls among physical and logical components; and
    • item: {{sa-17_smt.c}} - Expresses how individual security and privacy functions, mechanisms, and services work together to provide required security and privacy capabilities and a unified approach to protection.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-17.1 - Formal Policy Model
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-17.1_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to:
    • item: {{sa-17.1_smt.a}} - Produce, as an integral part of the development process, a formal policy model describing the {{ sa-17.1_prm_1 }} to be enforced; and
    • item: {{sa-17.1_smt.b}} - Prove that the formal policy model is internally consistent and sufficient to enforce the defined elements of the organizational security and privacy policy when implemented.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
{{sa-17.1_prm_1}}: organization-defined elements of organizational security and privacy policy

securityControls.title: sa-17.2 - Security-relevant Components
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-17.2_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to:
    • item: {{sa-17.2_smt.a}} - Define security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware; and
    • item: {{sa-17.2_smt.b}} - Provide a rationale that the definition for security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware is complete.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-17.3 - Formal Correspondence
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-17.3_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to:
    • item: {{sa-17.3_smt.a}} - Produce, as an integral part of the development process, a formal top-level specification that specifies the interfaces to security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware in terms of exceptions, error messages, and effects;
    • item: {{sa-17.3_smt.b}} - Show via proof to the extent feasible with additional informal demonstration as necessary, that the formal top-level specification is consistent with the formal policy model;
    • item: {{sa-17.3_smt.c}} - Show via informal demonstration, that the formal top-level specification completely covers the interfaces to security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware;
    • item: {{sa-17.3_smt.d}} - Show that the formal top-level specification is an accurate description of the implemented security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware; and
    • item: {{sa-17.3_smt.e}} - Describe the security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware mechanisms not addressed in the formal top-level specification but strictly internal to the security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-17.4 - Informal Correspondence
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-17.4_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to:
    • item: {{sa-17.4_smt.a}} - Produce, as an integral part of the development process, an informal descriptive top-level specification that specifies the interfaces to security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware in terms of exceptions, error messages, and effects;
    • item: {{sa-17.4_smt.b}} - Show via {{ sa-17.4_prm_1 }} that the descriptive top-level specification is consistent with the formal policy model;
    • item: {{sa-17.4_smt.c}} - Show via informal demonstration, that the descriptive top-level specification completely covers the interfaces to security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware;
    • item: {{sa-17.4_smt.d}} - Show that the descriptive top-level specification is an accurate description of the interfaces to security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware; and
    • item: {{sa-17.4_smt.e}} - Describe the security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware mechanisms not addressed in the descriptive top-level specification but strictly internal to the security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware.


  • Guidance
securityControls.mappings:
Parameters
sa-17.4_prm_1, informal demonstration, convincing argument with formal methods as feasible,

securityControls.title: sa-17.5 - Conceptually Simple Design
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-17.5_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to:
    • item: {{sa-17.5_smt.a}} - Design and structure the security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware to use a complete, conceptually simple protection mechanism with precisely defined semantics; and
    • item: {{sa-17.5_smt.b}} - Internally structure the security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware with specific regard for this mechanism.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-17.6 - Structure for Testing

  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sa-17.7 - Structure for Least Privilege
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sa-17.7_smt}}, Name: statement - Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to structure security-relevant hardware, software, and firmware to facilitate controlling access with least privilege.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sc-3.4 - Module Coupling and Cohesiveness
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sc-3.4_smt}}, Name: statement - Implement security functions as largely independent modules that maximize internal cohesiveness within modules and minimize coupling between modules.

securityControls.title: sc-3.5 - Layered Structures
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{sc-3.5_smt}}, Name: statement - Implement security functions as a layered structure minimizing interactions between layers of the design and avoiding any dependence by lower layers on the functionality or correctness of higher layers.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: si-4 - System Monitoring
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{si-4_smt}}, Name: statement - 1. Strategically within the system to collect organization-determined essential information; and 1. At ad hoc locations within the system to track specific types of transactions of interest to the organization;
    • item: {{si-4_smt.a}} - Monitor the system to detect:
      • item: {{si-4_smt.a.1}} - Attacks and indicators of potential attacks in accordance with the following monitoring objectives: {{ si-4_prm_1 }}; and
      • item: {{si-4_smt.a.2}} - Unauthorized local, network, and remote connections;
    • item: {{si-4_smt.b}} - Identify unauthorized use of the system through the following techniques and methods: {{ si-4_prm_2 }};
    • item: {{si-4_smt.c}} - Invoke internal monitoring capabilities or deploy monitoring devices:
    • item: {{si-4_smt.d}} - Analyze detected events and anomalies;
    • item: {{si-4_smt.e}} - Adjust the level of system monitoring activity when there is a change in risk to organizational operations and assets, individuals, other organizations, or the Nation;
    • item: {{si-4_smt.f}} - Obtain legal opinion regarding system monitoring activities; and

securityControls.title: si-19.4 - Removal, Masking, Encryption, Hashing, or Replacement of Direct Identifiers
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{si-19.4_smt}}, Name: statement - Remove, mask, encrypt, hash, or replace direct identifiers in a dataset.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: si-19.5 - Statistical Disclosure Control
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{si-19.5_smt}}, Name: statement - Manipulate numerical data, contingency tables, and statistical findings so that no individual or organization is identifiable in the results of the analysis.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: si-19.6 - Differential Privacy
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{si-19.6_smt}}, Name: statement - Prevent disclosure of personally identifiable information by adding non-deterministic noise to the results of mathematical operations before the results are reported.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: si-19.7 - Validated Algorithms and Software
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{si-19.7_smt}}, Name: statement - Perform de-identification using validated algorithms and software that is validated to implement the algorithms.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: si-19.8 - Motivated Intruder
securityControls.description:
• ID: {{si-19.8_smt}}, Name: statement - Perform a motivated intruder test on the de-identified dataset to determine if the identified data remains or if the de-identified data can be re-identified.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sr-1 - Policy and Procedures
securityControls.description:
• item: {{sr-1_smt.a}} - Develop, document, and disseminate to {{ sr-1_prm_1 }}:
      • item: {{sr-1_smt.a.1}} - {{ sr-1_prm_2 }} supply chain risk management policy that:
        • item: {{sr-1_smt.a.1.a}} - Addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and
        • item: {{sr-1_smt.a.1.b}} - Is consistent with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines; and
      • item: {{sr-1_smt.a.2}} - Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the supply chain risk management policy and the associated supply chain risk management controls;
    • item: {{sr-1_smt.b}} - Designate an {{ sr-1_prm_3 }} to manage the development, documentation, and dissemination of the supply chain risk management policy and procedures; and
    • item: {{sr-1_smt.c}} - Review and update the current supply chain risk management:
      • item: {{sr-1_smt.c.1}} - Policy {{ sr-1_prm_4 }} and following {{ sr-1_prm_5 }}; and
      • item: {{sr-1_smt.c.2}} - Procedures {{ sr-1_prm_6 }} and following {{ sr-1_prm_7 }}.


  • Guidance

securityControls.title: sr-2 - Supply Chain Risk Management Plan

    • item: {{sr-2_smt.b}} - Review and update the supply chain risk management plan {{ sr-2_prm_2 }} or as required, to address threat, organizational or environmental changes; and
    • item: {{sr-2_smt.c}} - Protect the supply chain risk management plan from unauthorized disclosure and modification.


  • Guidance
